Hi Lieve,
 
I've seen this issue with the junit gui and presumably it's related to the
classloader features often discussed on the forum.  I put in the -noload
thingy and the cast error went away.
 
Regards,
 
Shaun O'Hagan
London UK.

-----Original Message-----
From: ext Lieve Laporte [mailto:lieve.laporte@...]
Sent: Tuesday, May 29, 2001 8:40 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] JUnit for EJBs


Hello,
 
I've tried to use JUnit for testing EJBs on Weblogic server, but this
doesn't seem to work: I always get a java.lang.ClassCastException:
...BeanHomeImpl_WLStub, when trying to call the bean's home interface. This
isn't the case when I test the EJB using another Java client. Can anyone
explain why this problem occurs?
 
Thanks,
 
Lieve
